html:
fakter
postman
i
{\PM}
n
{\COMP}
amen
bring
let
letter
isi?
here
src: fakter i n amen let isi?
trs: Did the postman bring a letter (here)?'\footnote{Note that \textit{fakter} `postman' also lacks an article, although the definite article is required in English. But in fact, the NP here is as nonspecific as \textit{let}. `\textsc{the} postman', `\textsc{the} doctor', `\textsc{the} cashier', etc., are really role titles. Postmen often change routes and schedules, and there is no indication in the sentence that one particular postman might have brought the letter, that either the speaker or the listener could have answered the question ``\textsc{which} postman?'' or that the identity of the postman had the slightest relevance to the topic.}
